column4: hello, I've just installed Ubuntu 9.04 Jaunty, but my resolution is very low.. 800 X 600 ... and it does not detect my "Ultra '17" Monitor... my card is NVidia Riva TNT2 Model 64" .. what is the problem ? in the Video Card or in the Monitor ? this resolution is very looooow.. please help
I'm trying to find the problem but I cannot find it,....
can anyone help me with my problem ?
I don't solve problems I cause them
Wow I'm actually using some of my swap file
i'm not in the mood for games now.. I have a real problem
whats the problem

hello, I've just installed Ubuntu 9.04 Jaunty, but my resolution is very low.. 800 X 600 ... and it does not detect my "Ultra '17" Monitor... my card is NVidia Riva TNT2 Model 64" .. what is the problem ? in the Video Card or in the Monitor ? this resolution is very looooow.. please help
that's the problem
sure you have the right drivers?
A TNT2 will require legacy drivers
how can I check if I have the default ones ?
I'm a little newbie in these things
System > Administration > Hardware Drivers
Can't open display in randr
Hardware drivers do not reveal proprietary drivers
it's empty there
and how should I proceed ?
what steps must I take to resolve the problem ?
It found my invidia drivers.  Add in the Medibuntu repository into your software sources
ok, wait, adding repository
ok, I've added the Medibuntu repository. Now how do I use synaptic to install the driver ? I've typed "nvidia" but it gives me the same packages
freeanshu , what should I do next ?
